passage_text: Netting is a process the National Securities Clearing Corporation (NSCC) uses to streamline securities transactions. To net, the NSCC compares all the buy and sell orders for each individual security and matches purchases by clients of one brokerage firm with corresponding sales by other clients of the firm.

Definition: Intercompany netting is the offsetting of accounts receivable and accounts payable between two business entities owned by the same parent, so that payment is only made for the net difference between their receivables and payables.
